discourse_list.title: [Discussion] Optional feature to vote on all current available proposals in one transaction

content.content: I would like to propose a new optional feature to increase the convenience on voting on governance proposals. Let the MKR holders optionally vote on all current available proposals on one page and in one transaction. I don’t know how other MKR holders feel, but just thinking about confirming four transactions on a hardware wallet might make a MKR holder think about if he/she really wants to go through with it… I just want to put this thought/feature up for discussion. Maybe it is not even technical feasible or not worth it. Feel free to open a signaling thread or change this into one.
content.GPT-summary: The author proposes a new optional feature to increase convenience on voting on governance proposals. The feature would allow MKR holders to vote on all current available proposals on one page and in one transaction. The author invites discussion on the feasibility and worth of the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Internal transactions are much cheaper than separate transactions, so long as they don’t create new accounts. I support this feature.
Strongly support! It’s finally time for @Mariano_Conti to let the batched/botched transaction tutorial out the bag

I really like this idea! It would be a major improvement to the user flow and I’m sure we’d achieve higher participation too. Unfortunately with the current smart contract implementation it would require a rewrite, so quite a bit of work. It’s not something we could do right now. Despite this, I’ll discuss with the smart contracts team for consideration in a future version. There are still UI enhancements we can do on the front end without contract changes so that’s still on the table with the existing back-end.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
